title: Taric's heal is still a joke; but I have a solution!
body:
Lower the ABSURD mana cost and slightly reduce the healing power.

This way it becomes a cheap and easy way to trigger Bravado (His passive) and increase his general effectiveness without actually giving him more healing power. 140 mana cost for his heal at rank 5 is a fucking joke, Riot sama... even 60 for rank 1 (20 HP heal with 1 charge, 60 for max charges) is nonsense.

I get that you are balancing this heal around the "Potential" of healing 5 people.... but that only produces a terrible heal for a huge cost in every other scenario.

**EDIT**:
I'm not saying that Taric is bad or that he needs a buff... I'm NOT saying that.... what I am saying , by Riot's own admission he was NOT designed to be a primary healer like Soraka or Nami ...., which is fine that makes perfect sense, but he is saddled with primary healer mana costs for some insane reason and again, this is because POTENTIALLY, his heal can hit 5 people with 3 charges doing a pretty decent team heal.

This is not the case in 99% of casts. Therefore, it is almost always a very weak, very expensive heal for a huge mana cost. I say lower the heal , lower the mana cost and make it an easy way to trigger Bravado.

So quick pop in from a Taric main who has been there and back again.

Now some of you may remember me as the Taric main who argued against changing his Q at all.  This was because I firmly believed it was an important balancing tool.  I still believe this.  However I have also been doing some playtesting with different styles on my own time and have come to a couple conclusions.

So Taric has 2-3 general playstyles.  

1) Kill Shit Taric.  This is the Taric I played for a long time.  E max, aggressive play, death is the best cc.  When playing this style of Taric his heal is very balanced because rather than being around the healing it is balanced around his passive.  It lets him do short trades but hurts his long trades and all ins so that he can't just do it over and over.  In regards to this it is quite balanced.

2) Passive-er Taric.  This is the Taric that wants to sit around, go for the occasional trade, but mostly just wants to make it to late game and teamfight.  Not my personal favourite style but I put in the time on it to observe this.  This is the Taric that might throw a second point into Q vs heavy poke lanes.  He suffers early from the mana cost/limited heal on Q but I don't think that is a bad thing since this Taric is geared towards late game.  As this Taric will generally pick up a fairly early redemption a lot of the mana issues on Q fade out although the heal can still feel a bit stifling on a Taric who just wants to live until late game.

I don't think his heal _needs_ changes here but a little something might be nice.

3)  Healer Taric.  Recently the Taric I have picked up.  Q max.  Windspeakers.  A lot of mana regen in your runes.  This is the Taric I have been having fun with lately.  It is honestly pretty strong and in theory should be amazing outside of lane.  However it can suffer pretty hard there surprisingly.  This is due to his passive and not being able to always proc it as a healer.

--------------------------------------------

So what can we see here?  It is pretty balanced for an aggressive Taric but as you get more and more passive/more Q focus it gets worse, even though it should be your focus.  There are a couple actions that can balance that out though.  Two in particular that I have been considering.

1)  Lower mana cost at higher ranks.  This keeps the same restriction on aggressive Tarics as it is the limiter on them.  However it lets Taric that want to get to late game or focus on healing still be effective as they level it up.

2)  Change how it interacts with his passive.  Currently his Q CD is very punishing without his passive.  It is the main drawback of playing healer Taric because you are so squishy.  So what if we changed his Q CD from 15 > 10 and had his passive reduction change from 6-3.3 > 3.5-1.925?  It leaves his Q on the same CD if he is proccing his passive but cuts his Q CD down otherwise.  This makes his combo exactly the same in fights while helping out a Taric who is hiding under turret.

Either one or both of those changes would help out Taric without touching aggressive Taric which is what his Q is currently balanced around.
